rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today we are learning about giving our children praise. 

Praise is good for building positive relationships, and is also helpful at encouraging good behaviour!

Well done for taking time to learn how to strengthen your relationship with your child. It shows you really care!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today we are learning about giving our children praise. 

Praise is good for building positive relationships, and is also helpful at encouraging good behaviour!

Well done for taking time to learn how to strengthen your relationship with your child. It shows you really care!

quiz_1_question.eng: How did the message above make you feel?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That's great! Being praised often makes us feel proud.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That's great! Being praised often makes us feel happy!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Sometimes being praised makes us feel embarrassed, usually because we are not used to it. It will get easier with practice! Giving praise helps children learn the behaviours you want to see.

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: Sometimes, when we are praised for actions that we don't feel we deserve, we get sad. It is okay to feel sad, but remember that just being here is worthy of praise!

rows.quiz_1_question: How did the message above make you feel?
rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: That's great! Being praised often makes us feel proud.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: That's great! Being praised often makes us feel happy!
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: Sometimes being praised makes us feel embarrassed, usually because we are not used to it. It will get easier with practice! Giving praise helps children learn the behaviours you want to see.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_4: Sometimes, when we are praised for actions that we don't feel we deserve, we get sad. It is okay to feel sad, but remember that just being here is worthy of praise!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
We all feel better when we are praised.

Praising your child when they behave well will make them want to behave that way more often. 

It also creates a positive and loving relationship between you.

Begin by praising your child during your one-on-one time.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
We all feel better when we are praised.

Praising your child when they behave well will make them want to behave that way more often. 

It also creates a positive and loving relationship between you.

Begin by praising your child during your one-on-one time.

media_title.eng: How will it help you and your family?

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings, everyone.

When was the last time you were praised? Can you praise yourself for something right now? Praise makes us all feel good. 

It is good to praise our children when they have done well, because when we do that, they will do more of that good behaviour we want to see.

And let's remember to praise ourselves too, for big or small things!

rows.media_title: How will it help you and your family?
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings, everyone.

When was the last time you were praised? Can you praise yourself for something right now? Praise makes us all feel good. 

It is good to praise our children when they have done well, because when we do that, they will do more of that good behaviour we want to see.

And let's remember to praise ourselves too, for big or small things!

rows.text_1_facilitator: @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name’s grandaughter is playing with her magnet tiles while he watches a soccer match on TV  (Manchester United vs. Arsenal)

text_1_facilitator.eng: @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name’s grandaughter is playing with her magnet tiles while he watches a soccer match on TV  (Manchester United vs. Arsenal)

text_2.eng: (_On the TV_) 1-1 draw at interval between Manchester United and Arsenal!

rows.text_2: (_On the TV_) 1-1 draw at interval between Manchester United and Arsenal!
The match stops for a break.

text_2.eng: The match stops for a break.

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name, thank you for playing quietly on the floor. I really like that.

rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name, thank you for playing quietly on the floor. I really like that.

rows.text_2: (_On the TV_) 2-2 final score! What a match!

text_2.eng: (_On the TV_) 2-2 final score! What a match!

rows.character_1_text: @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name, you played nice and quietly by yourself while I watched the match. Now I will play with you for a bit. What would you like to do?

character_1_text.eng: @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name, you played nice and quietly by yourself while I watched the match. Now I will play with you for a bit. What would you like to do?

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let’s reflect on what we saw.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s reflect on what we saw.

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Exactly! When @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name praises @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name, she is more likely to repeat the positive behaviour

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: To make her feel good about herself.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Not exactly, but the praise does help her to identify what behaviour is expected of her.

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: To tell her he thinks she is the best

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Not exactly, but the praise will help build a positive relationship and encourage her positive behaviour in the future.

quiz_2_question.eng: What can we learn from @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name in how he praises @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name?

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: He yells so she is sure to hear him.

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: False. @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name doesn’t yell at all but he does go down to @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name’s level. This is important so he can connect to her. @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name’s actions show us that the way we give praise is also important.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: He uses her name and makes eye contact

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: True! All @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name’s actions show us that the way we give praise is also important.

quiz_2_option_3_text.eng: He tells her she is a “good girl."

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: False. He praises @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name for something specific and provides the praise immediately. This shows us that the way we give praise is important for it to be effective.

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng: True! @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name praises @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name immediately after her positive behaviour.

quiz_3_question.eng: Why does @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name give @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name an extra playtime together?

quiz_3_feedback_1.eng: Giving a small reward can motivate children to repeat tasks they find challenging.

quiz_3_option_2_text.eng: So that she knows that she doesn’t have to be quiet again while he watches TV

quiz_3_feedback_2.eng: Actually, the reward will encourage her to be quiet again in the future! Giving a small reward can motivate children to repeat tasks they find challenging.

quiz_3_option_3_text.eng: To encourage her to stay quiet while he watches TV

quiz_3_feedback_3.eng: That’s right, giving a simple reward helps our children to do things that may be difficult for them again.

rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: Exactly! When @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name praises @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name, she is more likely to repeat the positive behaviour
rows.quiz_1_option_2_text: To make her feel good about herself.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: Not exactly, but the praise does help her to identify what behaviour is expected of her.
rows.quiz_1_option_3_text: To tell her he thinks she is the best
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: Not exactly, but the praise will help build a positive relationship and encourage her positive behaviour in the future.

This is important so he can connect to her. @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name’s actions show us that the way we give praise is also important.

rows.quiz_2_feedback_2: True! All @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name’s actions show us that the way we give praise is also important.

rows.quiz_2_feedback_3: False. He praises @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name for something specific and provides the praise immediately. This shows us that the way we give praise is important for it to be effective.

rows.quiz_3_question: Why does @data.characters.f2_grandfather.name give @data.characters.f2_daughter_3.name an extra playtime together?
rows.quiz_3_feedback_1: Giving a small reward can motivate children to repeat tasks they find challenging.
rows.quiz_3_option_2_text: So that she knows that she doesn’t have to be quiet again while he watches TV
rows.quiz_3_feedback_2: Actually, the reward will encourage her to be quiet again in the future! Giving a small reward can motivate children to repeat tasks they find challenging.

rows.quiz_3_feedback_3: That’s right, giving a simple reward helps our children to do things that may be difficult for them again.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Here are some simple tips for using praise effectively:

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are some simple tips for using praise effectively:

section_1_text.eng: Be on the lookout for good behaviour! When offering praise, focus on anything positive or helpful your child does or attempts to do.

section_1_extra_text.eng:
Pause and really notice when they are doing something positive. Even if it’s expected of them.

Praise your child for *trying*. This boosts their self-esteem and confidence, which helps them to learn new behaviours.

section_2_text.eng: Praise them when you see them do something you like. Do this every day – even if it’s something really small.

section_2_extra_text.eng:
Tell them specifically what they have done well.

Be enthusiastic and really mean it!

You can show your praise with a big smile and words.

section_3_text.eng: Give your child a simple, free reward to encourage them to do more of the behaviours that you have praised them for.

section_3_extra_text.eng:
Rewards should be simple and free. 

Give your child a hug, extra playtime together, or make their favourite meal. 

Simple rewards can be a big motivation for your child to keep trying and show more positive behaviour.

rows.section_1_text: Be on the lookout for good behaviour! When offering praise, focus on anything positive or helpful your child does or attempts to do.
rows.section_1_extra_text:
Pause and really notice when they are doing something positive. Even if it’s expected of them.

Praise your child for *trying*. This boosts their self-esteem and confidence, which helps them to learn new behaviours.
rows.section_2_text: Praise them when you see them do something you like. Do this every day – even if it’s something really small.
rows.section_2_extra_text:
Tell them specifically what they have done well.

Be enthusiastic and really mean it!

You can show your praise with a big smile and words.
rows.section_3_text: Give your child a simple, free reward to encourage them to do more of the behaviours that you have praised them for.
rows.section_3_extra_text:
Rewards should be simple and free. 

Give your child a hug, extra playtime together, or make their favourite meal. 

Simple rewards can be a big motivation for your child to keep trying and show more positive behaviour.

rows.text_1_facilitator:
Curious to see how praise can help you and your family?

Your home activity is to praise your child for 3 things every day, and praise yourself too for all your hard work being a parent – you deserve it!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Curious to see how praise can help you and your family?

Your home activity is to praise your child for 3 things every day, and praise yourself too for all your hard work being a parent – you deserve it!

quiz_1_question.eng:
What is one behaviour your child regularly shows in their daily routine that you can praise them for?
There are lots of right answers to this one!

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!

quiz_1_option_5_text.eng: Getting ready for school or bed

quiz_1_feedback_5.eng: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!

quiz_1_feedback_6.eng: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!

quiz_2_question.eng: Remember to also praise yourself for the good work you're doing! What’s one way you can reward yourself for your hard work as a parent?

quiz_2_option_1_text.eng: Treat yourself to something you enjoy (e.g., a favourite snack or activity)

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Great choice! Taking time to enjoy something you love is a wonderful way to recharge and recognize your efforts as a parent.

quiz_2_option_2_text.eng: Take a few minutes to relax (e.g., meditation, a short walk, or just some quiet time)

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Well done! Giving yourself a moment to relax is so important. You’re doing a great job, and it’s okay to take a break.

quiz_2_option_3_text.eng: Celebrate by acknowledging your achievements (e.g., talking to a friend)

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: Fantastic! Reflecting on your accomplishments helps you see how much you’re doing right. You deserve to celebrate your hard work!

quiz_2_option_4_text.eng: Do something fun with your child that you both enjoy

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng: Wonderful choice! Sharing a fun activity with your child not only rewards you but also strengthens your bond. You’re doing an amazing job!

quiz_2_feedback_5.eng: Great idea! However you choose to reward yourself, it’s important to acknowledge the effort you put into parenting. You deserve it!
